tasks.title: Setup Project Repository and CI/CD Pipeline
tasks.description: Initialize Next.js 14 project with TypeScript, configure Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui, and setup GitHub Actions for lint, type-check, and build
tasks.details:
1. Create Next.js 14 project with App Router and TypeScript: `npx create-next-app@latest green-thumb --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app`
2. Install dependencies: `npm install lucide-react swr @types/node`
3. Setup shadcn/ui: `npx shadcn-ui@latest init`
4. Configure Tailwind with custom colors: primary-500 #22c55e, secondary-500 #3b82f6, neutral-900 #0f172a
5. Create GitHub Actions workflow in `.github/workflows/ci.yml` with lint, type-check, and build steps
6. Setup Vercel deployment configuration
7. Create folder structure: `/content/lessons`, `/data`, `/public`, `/lib`, `/app/api`
tasks.testStrategy: Verify project builds successfully, all linting passes, TypeScript compilation succeeds, and Vercel deployment works

subtasks.title: Initialize Next.js 14 Project with TypeScript and App Router
subtasks.description: Create a new Next.js 14 project using the App Router and TypeScript with Tailwind CSS and ESLint configured.
subtasks.details: Run the command `npx create-next-app@latest green-thumb --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app` to scaffold the project with the required options.

subtasks.title: Install Additional Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install necessary runtime and type dependencies including lucide-react, swr, and @types/node.
subtasks.details: Run `npm install lucide-react swr @types/node` inside the project directory to add these packages.

subtasks.title: Setup shadcn/ui Component Library
subtasks.description: Initialize the shadcn/ui component library within the project to provide UI components.
subtasks.details: Execute `npx shadcn-ui@latest init` to set up the UI library scaffolding and configuration.

subtasks.title: Configure Tailwind CSS with Custom Colors
subtasks.description: Customize Tailwind CSS configuration to include specific color palette for primary, secondary, and neutral colors.
subtasks.details: Modify the Tailwind config file to add custom colors: primary-500 (#22c55e), secondary-500 (#3b82f6), and neutral-900 (#0f172a).

subtasks.title: Create GitHub Actions Workflow for CI
subtasks.description: Set up a GitHub Actions workflow to run linting, TypeScript type-checking, and build steps on push or pull request.
subtasks.details: Create `.github/workflows/ci.yml` with jobs for lint, type-check, and build to ensure code quality and build integrity.

subtasks.title: Configure Vercel Deployment
subtasks.description: Set up deployment configuration for Vercel to automatically deploy the Next.js project.
subtasks.details: Connect the project repository to Vercel and configure environment variables and build settings as needed for deployment.

subtasks.title: Organize Project Folder Structure
subtasks.description: Establish a clear and maintainable folder structure for the project source code and assets.
subtasks.details: Create folders such as `app/` for routes, `components/` for UI components, `lib/` for utilities and contexts, and `public/` for static assets.

tasks.title: Implement Core State Management with React Context
tasks.description: Create React Context providers for watch-list management and lesson progress tracking
tasks.details:
1. Create `lib/contexts/WatchListContext.tsx` with:
   - State: `watchList: string[]` (ticker symbols)
   - Actions: `addTicker(symbol: string)`, `removeTicker(symbol: string)`
   - Persist state in memory only
2. Create `lib/contexts/ProgressContext.tsx` with:
   - State: `completedLessons: string[]` (lesson slugs)
   - Actions: `markLessonComplete(slug: string)`
3. Create `lib/contexts/AppProvider.tsx` to wrap both contexts
4. Add TypeScript interfaces for all context types
5. Implement context hooks: `useWatchList()`, `useProgress()`
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests with React Testing Library to verify context state updates, add/remove operations, and proper TypeScript typing

subtasks.title: Define TypeScript Interfaces for Contexts
subtasks.description: Create TypeScript interfaces to define the shape of the WatchListContext and ProgressContext state and actions to ensure type safety.
subtasks.details: Define interfaces such as WatchListContextType with state (watchList: string[]) and actions (addTicker, removeTicker), and ProgressContextType with state (completedLessons: string[]) and action (markLessonComplete).

subtasks.title: Create WatchListContext Provider
subtasks.description: Implement the WatchListContext React context provider with state management and actions for adding and removing ticker symbols.
subtasks.details: Create `lib/contexts/WatchListContext.tsx` using React.createContext and useState hook to manage watchList state in memory, exposing addTicker and removeTicker functions typed with the defined interfaces.

subtasks.title: Create ProgressContext Provider
subtasks.description: Implement the ProgressContext React context provider with state management and action to mark lessons as complete.
subtasks.details: Create `lib/contexts/ProgressContext.tsx` using React.createContext and useState hook to manage completedLessons state in memory, exposing markLessonComplete function typed with the defined interfaces.

subtasks.title: Implement Combined AppProvider
subtasks.description: Create a combined AppProvider component that wraps both WatchListContext and ProgressContext providers to provide global state access.
subtasks.details: Create `lib/contexts/AppProvider.tsx` that composes WatchListContext.Provider and ProgressContext.Provider, wrapping children components to provide both contexts simultaneously.

subtasks.title: Implement Custom Hooks for Context Consumption
subtasks.description: Create custom React hooks to consume WatchListContext and ProgressContext easily with proper TypeScript typing and error handling.
subtasks.details: Implement hooks like useWatchList and useProgress that internally use React's useContext to access respective contexts, throwing errors if used outside providers, ensuring type safety and cleaner component usage.

tasks.title: Setup Alpha Vantage Integration with SWR
tasks.description: Implement stock price data fetching using Alpha Vantage API with SWR for caching and error handling
tasks.details:
1. Create `lib/api/alphaVantage.ts` with:
   - Function `fetchStockData(symbol: string)` using Alpha Vantage free tier
   - API endpoint: `https://www.alphavantage.co/query?function=TIME_SERIES_DAILY&symbol={symbol}&apikey={key}`
   - Error handling for rate limits and invalid symbols
2. Create `lib/hooks/useStockData.ts` with SWR:
   - 24-hour cache configuration
   - Automatic revalidation on focus
   - Error boundary integration
3. Add environment variable `NEXT_PUBLIC_ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY`
4. Create TypeScript interfaces for API response data
5. Implement graceful fallback UI for API failures
tasks.testStrategy: Mock API responses in tests, verify 24h caching works, test error states and rate limiting scenarios

subtasks.title: Create Alpha Vantage API Utility with Error Handling
subtasks.description: Develop a TypeScript utility module `lib/api/alphaVantage.ts` that fetches stock data from Alpha Vantage API, including robust error handling for rate limits and invalid symbols.
subtasks.details: Implement `fetchStockData(symbol: string)` function using Alpha Vantage's TIME_SERIES_DAILY endpoint. Handle API key usage from environment variables and parse JSON responses. Detect and manage errors such as API rate limiting and invalid stock symbols gracefully.

subtasks.title: Implement SWR Hook for Stock Data Fetching with Caching and Revalidation
subtasks.description: Create a custom React hook `lib/hooks/useStockData.ts` using SWR to fetch and cache stock data with a 24-hour cache duration and automatic revalidation on window focus.
subtasks.details: Configure SWR to cache data for 24 hours, enable revalidation on focus, and integrate error boundary handling to display errors from the API utility. Ensure the hook returns loading, error, and data states properly typed with TypeScript interfaces.

subtasks.title: Setup Environment Variables for API Key Management
subtasks.description: Configure environment variables to securely store and access the Alpha Vantage API key within the application.
subtasks.details: Add `NEXT_PUBLIC_ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY` to environment configuration files. Ensure the API utility reads the key from this variable and that it is not exposed insecurely in client bundles. Document environment setup for development and production.

subtasks.title: Define TypeScript Interfaces for API Responses and Hook Data
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive TypeScript interfaces to type the Alpha Vantage API responses and the data returned by the SWR hook.
subtasks.details: Analyze Alpha Vantage API JSON response structure and define interfaces for time series data, metadata, and error formats. Use these interfaces in the API utility and SWR hook to ensure type safety and IntelliSense support.

subtasks.title: Implement Fallback UI Components for Loading and Error States
subtasks.description: Develop reusable React components to display fallback UI during data loading and error conditions in the stock data fetching flow.
subtasks.details: Create components that show loading spinners or placeholders while data is being fetched, and error messages or retry options when API calls fail or rate limits are hit. Integrate these components with the SWR hook's returned states.

tasks.title: Create Lesson Content Structure and MDX Processing

1. Install MDX dependencies: `npm install @next/mdx @mdx-js/loader @mdx-js/react @types/mdx`
2. Configure `next.config.js` for MDX processing
3. Create lesson files in `/content/lessons/`:
   - `01-understanding-stocks-index-funds.mdx`
   - `02-reading-performance-charts.mdx`
   - `03-comparing-investments.mdx`
   - `04-research-before-you-buy.mdx`
   - `05-keeping-emotions-in-check.mdx`
   - `06-understanding-risk.mdx`

5. Create `lib/lessons.ts` utility to load and parse lesson metadata

subtasks.title: Install MDX Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install all necessary MDX-related packages including @next/mdx, @mdx-js/loader, @mdx-js/react, and their TypeScript types.

subtasks.title: Create Lesson MDX Files with Metadata

subtasks.details: Develop the following MDX files: 01-understanding-stocks-index-funds.mdx, 02-reading-performance-charts.mdx, 03-comparing-investments.mdx, 04-research-before-you-buy.mdx, 05-keeping-emotions-in-check.mdx, and 06-understanding-risk.mdx. Each file should include frontmatter or exported meta objects with structured metadata.

subtasks.title: Export Meta Objects and Implement Metadata Parsing Utility
subtasks.description: Ensure each MDX lesson file exports a meta object and create a utility function to parse and aggregate metadata from all lesson files.

subtasks.title: Ensure Teen-Friendly Content Style in Lessons

subtasks.details: Apply content guidelines to ensure language is accessible, engaging, and appropriate for teenagers, avoiding jargon and complex terminology while maintaining educational value.

subtasks.title: Test MDX Setup and Content Rendering
subtasks.description: Verify that MDX files parse correctly, metadata extraction works as expected, and lesson content renders properly in the Next.js application.
subtasks.details: Perform functional testing by loading lesson pages, checking metadata availability, and confirming that the teen-friendly content style is preserved in the rendered output.

tasks.title: Implement Encryption/Decryption API Routes
tasks.description: Create secure API endpoints for encrypting and decrypting user data using AES-256-GCM
tasks.details:
1. Create `app/api/encrypt/route.ts` with:
   - POST handler accepting JSON state data
   - AES-256-GCM encryption using Node.js crypto module
   - 32-byte key from `ENCRYPTION_KEY` environment variable
   - Return encrypted blob as application/octet-stream
   - 200KB payload size limit
   - 3-second maxDuration
2. Create `app/api/decrypt/route.ts` with:
   - POST handler accepting encrypted file data
   - Decrypt and return plain JSON
   - Proper error handling for malformed data
3. Create `lib/crypto.ts` utility functions
4. Add proper TypeScript types for API responses
5. Implement comprehensive error handling and validation
tasks.testStrategy: Test encryption/decryption roundtrip, verify file size limits, test malformed data handling, ensure environment key security

subtasks.title: Create AES-256-GCM Encryption API Route
subtasks.description: Implement the POST handler in `app/api/encrypt/route.ts` that accepts JSON state data, encrypts it using AES-256-GCM with a 32-byte key from the `ENCRYPTION_KEY` environment variable, and returns the encrypted blob as application/octet-stream. Enforce a 200KB payload size limit and a 3-second maximum duration for processing.
subtasks.details: Use Node.js crypto module for AES-256-GCM encryption. Generate a 12-byte IV (nonce) as per AES-GCM standard. Ensure proper error handling for invalid input and environment key issues.

subtasks.title: Create AES-256-GCM Decryption API Route
subtasks.description: Implement the POST handler in `app/api/decrypt/route.ts` that accepts encrypted file data, decrypts it using AES-256-GCM with the same 32-byte key, and returns the decrypted JSON data. Include robust error handling for malformed or invalid encrypted data.
subtasks.details: Use Node.js crypto module for decryption. Validate input format and handle authentication tag verification failures gracefully. Return appropriate HTTP error codes for decryption errors.

subtasks.title: Develop Crypto Utility Functions
subtasks.description: Create reusable utility functions for AES-256-GCM encryption and decryption to be used by both API routes. Include functions for key retrieval, IV generation, encryption, decryption, and authentication tag handling.
subtasks.details: Ensure utilities enforce 12-byte IV size for compatibility and security. Include input validation and error propagation. Abstract environment variable access for the encryption key.

subtasks.title: Add TypeScript Typings for API and Crypto Utilities
subtasks.description: Define comprehensive TypeScript interfaces and types for API request and response payloads, crypto utility function parameters and return types, and error objects to ensure type safety and developer clarity.
subtasks.details: Include types for JSON state data, encrypted binary data, error responses, and environment configuration. Use strict typing to prevent runtime errors and improve maintainability.

subtasks.title: Implement Comprehensive Error Handling and Validation
subtasks.description: Integrate thorough validation of inputs, payload sizes, and environment variables in both API routes and crypto utilities. Implement detailed error handling to catch and respond to malformed data, decryption failures, missing keys, and timeout breaches.
subtasks.details: Return meaningful HTTP status codes and error messages. Log errors securely without exposing sensitive data. Enforce the 200KB payload size and 3-second maxDuration constraints with appropriate error responses.

tasks.title: Build Save/Load Data Functionality

tasks.details:
1. Install file handling library: `npm install file-saver @types/file-saver`
2. Create `lib/dataManager.ts` with:

   - Error handling and user feedback
3. Create `components/DataManager.tsx` with:
   - "Download Data" button triggering file download
   - File input for selecting .gt files
   - Progress indicators during save/load
   - Success/error messages
4. Integrate with existing contexts to save/restore state
5. Default filename: `green-thumb-state.gt`
6. Add proper file type validation
tasks.testStrategy: Test complete save/load cycle, verify state persistence, test error scenarios (corrupted files, network issues), validate file type restrictions

subtasks.title: Install File Handling Libraries

subtasks.details: Run `npm install file-saver @types/file-saver` to add the FileSaver.js library for client-side file saving functionality. Verify installation and import usage in the project.

subtasks.title: Create DataManager Utility with Save/Load and State Merging
subtasks.description: Develop a utility module `lib/dataManager.ts` that handles saving current state by encrypting and posting to the API, loading encrypted files, decrypting, and merging loaded state with existing state.
subtasks.details: Implement `saveData()` to POST current app state to `/api/encrypt` and trigger file download. Implement `loadData()` to upload `.gt` files, POST to `/api/decrypt`, parse decrypted JSON, and merge with current state. Include error handling and user feedback mechanisms.

subtasks.title: Integrate DataManager with React Contexts
subtasks.description: Connect DataManager utility and component with existing React Context providers to access and update application state during save/load operations.
subtasks.details: Use contexts such as WatchListContext and ProgressContext to retrieve current state for saving and to update state after loading and merging. Ensure proper context typing and state synchronization.

subtasks.title: Define Filename Conventions for Saved Files

subtasks.details: Decide on filename format including extension `.gt` and possibly timestamp or user identifier. Implement naming logic in saveData and DataManager component to use this convention when triggering file downloads.

subtasks.title: Implement File Validation and Error Handling
subtasks.description: Add validation for uploaded files to ensure correct file type and format, and implement robust error handling for corrupted files, network errors, and invalid data during save/load.
subtasks.details: Validate file extension `.gt` and file content before processing. Handle errors from API decrypt endpoint gracefully, showing user-friendly messages. Include fallback and retry mechanisms as needed.

tasks.title: Create Parent Dashboard with Basic Authentication
tasks.description: Build password-protected parent dashboard showing teen's activity and progress
tasks.details:
1. Create `app/parent/page.tsx` with:

subtasks.title: Implement Keyboard Navigation

subtasks.title: Add ARIA Labels and Roles

subtasks.details: Use ARIA roles to define element types, add labels for unlabeled controls, and ensure dynamic content updates are announced.

subtasks.title: Ensure Color Contrast Compliance
subtasks.description: Verify that text and UI elements meet WCAG 2.2 AA minimum contrast ratios for readability.
subtasks.details: Check color contrast ratios for text, icons, and graphical elements using automated tools and manual verification.

subtasks.title: Conduct Screen Reader Testing

subtasks.title: Optimize Responsive Design for Breakpoints

subtasks.details: Test layout, font sizes, touch targets, and navigation at each breakpoint to maintain usability and accessibility.

subtasks.title: Test Touch Interaction on Mobile Devices

subtasks.title: Establish Proper Heading Hierarchy

subtasks.title: Ensure Chart Accessibility

subtasks.title: Add Alt Text for Images and Icons

subtasks.title: Perform Accessibility Tool Testing

subtasks.title: Setup Vitest and Testing Dependencies

subtasks.title: Configure Vitest
subtasks.description: Create or update vitest.config.ts to configure Vitest with React plugin, jsdom environment, global test APIs, and setup files.
subtasks.details: Configure Vitest to use the React plugin, set test environment to 'jsdom', enable globals for test functions, and specify a setup file for additional test configurations[1][3].

subtasks.title: Create Test Setup File
subtasks.description: Create a setupTests.ts file to configure Jest DOM matchers and cleanup after each test.
subtasks.details: In the setupTests.ts file, import '@testing-library/jest-dom' to add custom matchers and configure cleanup after each test to avoid side effects[1][3].

subtasks.title: Create Test Files for Components and Utilities
subtasks.description: Create test files covering all major React components, context providers, hooks, API integration functions, and encryption utilities.

subtasks.title: Implement Unit Tests

subtasks.details: Write focused unit tests to verify individual functions and components behave correctly in isolation, including state updates and UI behavior[1].

subtasks.title: Implement Integration Tests

subtasks.details: Develop tests that simulate real user scenarios involving multiple components and API interactions to ensure the system works as expected end-to-end[1].

subtasks.title: Setup Test Coverage Reporting

subtasks.title: Optimize Bundle Size

subtasks.details: Use tools like Vite bundle analyzer to identify large dependencies and optimize imports, remove unused code, and apply tree shaking to reduce bundle size.

subtasks.title: Implement Code Splitting and Performance Monitoring

subtasks.details: Configure dynamic imports and route-based code splitting in the build process. Integrate performance monitoring tools to track runtime metrics and identify bottlenecks.

subtasks.title: Implement Image Optimization and Pre-commit Hooks
